body.name: Ring Video Doorbell 4 – Previous Generation
body.stockDetail: Only 2 left in stock - order soon.
features: 1080p HD video doorbell with improved video previews and battery life.
All-new Color Pre-Roll Video Previews of all motion events means you’ll never miss a moment at your front door, day or night.
Enjoy customizable privacy zones and audio privacy, enhanced dual-band (2.4 or 5.0 GHz) wifi connectivity, and improved motion detection.
Receive mobile notifications when anyone presses your doorbell or triggers your built-in motion sensors.
Powered by a removable, rechargeable battery pack or connects to existing doorbell wires for constant power. Works on any home.
With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 180 days, and share videos and photos.
Save and share video and photos with an optional Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately).

For added peace of mind, pair with Alexa to help you keep an eye on your home. Connect with Alexa to hear motion alerts on your compatible Echo device or see a Live View with an Echo Show, Fire TV, or Fire Tablet. Talk to visitors by saying, “Alexa, talk to the front door.” With a Ring Protect plan (subscription sold separately), Alexa can also make voice announcements and automatically show live video feed on an Echo Show, Fire TV, or Fire Tablet when your Ring Video Doorbell detects a person.

productInformation.name: Video
productInformation.value: 1080 HD Live Video, Live View, Night Vision. Video quality for the color Pre-Roll feature is less than 1080p.

productInformation.name: Motion detection
productInformation.value: Motion detection Advanced Motion Detection with Customizable Motion Zones

productInformation.name: Audio
productInformation.value: Two-way audio with noise cancellation. Pre-Roll does not include audio.

productInformation.name: Power
productInformation.value: Runs on a removable, rechargeable, Quick-Release Battery Pack (included). Can be hardwired to an existing doorbell system or transformer for continuous charging (8-24 VAC, 40VA max, 50/60Hz) or connected to a Ring plug-in adapter. No halogen or garden-lighting transformers; no DC transformer/power supply. *Improved battery life is based on an average of 20 or more motion events per day as compared to Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus. Battery life will vary based on device settings, use, and environmental factors.

productInformation.name: Internet requirements
productInformation.value: Recommended minimum upload speed of 2 Mbps per device.

productInformation.name: Operating conditions
productInformation.value: -5°F to 120°F (-20°C to 50°C). Weather Resistant - when hardwired, the device allows charging in the range of 32°F to 113°F (0° to 45°C), otherwise charging is disabled.

productInformation.name: Dimensions
productInformation.value: 5.1 in. x 2.4 in x 1.1 in (128mm x 62mm x 28mm)

productInformation.name: Box Includes
productInformation.value: Video Doorbell 4 Rechargeable, Quick-Release Battery Pack Satin Nickel Faceplate: After device set up, you will receive a digital coupon for one free additional faceplate. Select colors apply. Corner Kit Installation Tools and Screws USB Charging Cable Quick Start Guide User Manual Security Sticker

productInformation.name: Setup requirements
productInformation.value: Only if wiring: Standard doorbell system, Ring plug-in adapter or transformer with 8-24 VAC, 40VA max, 50/60Hz or 24VDC, 0.5A, 12W

productInformation.name: Warranty and service
productInformation.value: 1-year limited warranty. Use of Ring Video Doorbell 4 is subject to the terms found here.

productInformation.name: Support
productInformation.value: Click here to view more information on the Ring Video Doorbell 4 support page.

productInformation.name: Ring Protect Plan
productInformation.value: By purchasing, you authorize us to charge your default card or another card on file when you attach the subscription to a device. Learn more about subscription features and additional terms and conditions.

productInformation.name: Software Security Updates
productInformation.value: This device receives guaranteed software security updates until at least four years after the device is last available for purchase as a new unit on our websites. Learn more about these software security updates. If you already own a Ring device, visit Software Security Updates in Ring Control Center for information specific to your device.

productInformation.name: Disclaimer
productInformation.value: 1Ring Alarm and all Ring Alarm accessories require a subscription for in-app features and digital notifications, including but not limited to: digital arming / disarming and integration with other Ring, Echo, Alexa, and third party products. Subscription sold separately. View Ring Protect Plans for pricing and details. Customer reviews may reference features that require a subscription.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Ultimate Home Security Solution
reviews.reviewText: The Ring Video Doorbell 4 is an excellent home security solution that I highly recommend to anyone looking for a reliable and easy-to-use video doorbell. The video doorbell features a high-definition camera that provides clear and detailed video footage of your doorstep, allowing you to see and communicate with visitors from anywhere using your smartphone.One of the things I love about the Ring Video Doorbell 4 is its advanced features. The doorbell features a built-in rechargeable battery, making it easy to install without any wiring. It also has customizable motion detection, which allows you to adjust the sensitivity of the motion sensors to reduce false alerts. Plus, the doorbell is compatible with Alexa, which allows you to control the doorbell with your voice.The Ring Video Doorbell 4 is also incredibly easy to install and use. The installation process is straightforward and can be completed in just a few minutes, even for those who are not tech-savvy. Once installed, the doorbell works seamlessly with the Ring app, which provides access to all the features and settings of the doorbell.Overall, I highly recommend the Ring Video Doorbell 4 to anyone looking for a reliable and advanced home security solution. The doorbell is easy to install, packed with features, and provides excellent video quality, making it an essential investment for anyone who values security and convenience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Honest review of Ring Doorbell 4
reviews.reviewText: We moved into a new home and needed some way to monitor the front porch area and the driveway. After a lot of research we chose the Ring 4, mainly for the camera roll feature which lets you see the 4 seconds prior to the notification that someone is at your door.Installation: Pretty easy but if you are mounting to siding, use something else besides the included screws. The screw heads are too small to firmly hold it to siding.Pairing with WiFi: Super easy with the App and flawless connectivity. About as simple as it can be made in terms of pairing.Picture: Generally good. The camera roll feature is far less clear than it’s normal recording.Sound: Surprisingly good. The microphone is very good and I can hear everything when turned on. The two way communication works well.Battery life: Good. If you adjust the settings to avoid live updates every few minutes the battery life stretches out a lot. Battery costs are reasonable if you want a spare but they all take 6-10 hours to charge fully.Do you need Chime? Heck no. The hook up to phones is simple and many people in the house can be easily connected to the Ring 4, so why bother. People are inseparable from their phones these days anyway so no issues there. If someone is at the door all 3 phones in the house go off, so it’s a no brainer!Features: More than you will need. Package notification, timers to avoid unnecessary notifications, geolocation to keep those same notifications to an area, battery health, etc. it’s all there.Overall you get what you pay for. I think this was well worth the cost.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Camera for Peace of Mind
reviews.reviewText: I have went back & forth on whether or not I really needed to dish out the money for this Ring Doorbell 4, I would look up reviews and do research then I would just be like eh it’s fine I don’t need it that bad especially being on a tighter budget. Well income tax time hit and I seen this one was $60 off the original price & so I went for it & OMG I’m sooooo glad I did! It’s Amazing, I absolutely Love being able to see who is at my front door or even close to my porch I didn’t screw mount mine because I live in Townhouse Apartments and I’m sure that is a no no lol so I got a no screw door mount for it and it’s perfect for apartment living, the camera quality is really nice, it’s very fast at alerting me if someone is on or near my porch or door, it look very sleek and appealing, it came with a Ring Sticker so I got a magnet and stuck the sticker to the magnet and since my door is metal it just sticks magnetically I can remove it when I need so it’s not permanent so that’s an idea for you, but overall if your going back and forth like I was just get it and I promise you won’t be disappointed it’s awesome!! The setup was extremely fast and easy using the Ring app, it connected to myWi-Fi seamlessly with no problems I have spectrum not sure if it matters, the app loads up the camera very fast, the sound quality is great, the lights on the ring are nice and bright when they light up, overall I highly recommend this Ring Doorbell to anyone thinking of getting one, I’m also going to buy a second one for my back door, also the battery seems to last really well I’ve had it a few days it’s only went down by 2% from 100% to 98% but I have also been fidgeting with it a lot moving it around until I got the best spot and obsessively watching the camera lol so I’m sure the batter would still be at 100% if I would just be normal and stop watching it all day! I did charge the battery for about 10 hours when I very first got it just to make sure it was full charge before using it! I will buy a second battery just to always have a charged ready to go battery when the other one needs charged up :) Thanks for ready my review I hope you enjoy your new Ring Doorbell just as much as I do

Amazing product saves a lot of time and I feel a lot more secure with my packages. The plus points are that when they ring the bell the sound goes off at the bell and also ur phone does a door bell notification sound if you have enabled it in the app so u get the ring no matter where u are home or not. If u don’t want to give anyone else access simply Combine it with the chime and u can make sure anyone hears the bell even if they are in the top floor and finally the battery life is beautiful. It does take about 6 hours to fully charge but after just one charge the battery is still at 75% after 10 days. Don’t need to stress about buying an extra battery.

This doorbell camera is absolutely amazing. It is so good, high quality, came in-tact, fast shipping, definetly recommend. I have attached photos of how it came, including the box, information given, packaging, and the actual doorbell itself. It came in a protected box, no dents or damages. Inside the box the wires, screwdriver and doorbell, as well as instructions. I attached it at the front of my house next to my door, and it works so well! Clear quality, motion senses are good, is secure, night vision works well. Battery is good, and colours in display are great. Notifications work on my phone, and overall, the whole thing is just great! I highly recommend this product for anyone who wants a working doorbell. Hope you find this review helpful!

reviews.reviewTitle: An excellent product, but could have been easier to set up
reviews.reviewText: This doorbell works well, and has good hardware design, but could have been easier to set up in terms of connecting to my wi-fi network, and the recommended upload speed (on the product's internet site) was not strong enough to provide a reliable connection (but changes to my home wi-fi mean I have more than triple the recommended upload speed at the doorbell location now, and it works well). While I got a Chime Pro to assist with the connection, it didn't provide any better connection strength (despite being in a better and somewhat closer location) than my modem/router, although that will vary based on the strength of signal coming from your modem/router.The phone app is good, the battery life also good (about 2 weeks, with a fair bit of motion detection and recording), the process of replacing the battery straightforward, and the information available via the app and the recordings of the videos via the Protect Plan excellent. The design and physical installation were both good, and the range of faceplates met our needs in terms of blending in with the complex. It's very handy to be able to communicate with someone who arrives at the door when I'm not in, and the customisable motion zones and pre-roll features are noticeably useful (particularly the customisable motion zones, as the doorbell faces a busy street, so being able to cover the letterbox but not the road avoids a lot of car recordings).Other than the upload speed/connection issues, other things that needed resolving during set-up (in case it helps anyone who bumps into similar):- For whatever reason, the Chime Pro (2nd edition) doesn’t work with (at least my) ‘combined’ 2.4GHz and 5GHz wi-fi network – I needed to split it into two separate networks for it to hook up. When it was combined, it repeatedly (and incorrectly) gave the error that the password was incorrect (and the password was checked carefully, and was fine, and worked once the networks had been split).- On a combined 2.4GHz and 5GHz wi-fi network, the Ring 4 video doorbell for some reason decided that it wanted to connect to the 5GHz signal (RSSIs from 72 to 78) rather than the 2.4GHz signal (RSSIs of 55-65, even without the Chime Pro).Working around this was a bit fiddly (made moreso by some issues on my ISP's end - but that's not a doorbell issue), but once everything was set up, it works very well, and is a great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: You Can Keep An Eye on Things From Afar.
reviews.reviewText: Initially our nbn/internet would not link our football 4 into our network. However, after several attempts it is now linked into our system and works extremely well. I get a notification if someone rings our doorbell and I can see them on my phone. It also allows us to see people going past through the motion sensor. I am about to try and use the microphone to speak to visitors when we are away. This can be done through the doorbell. I just haven’t got around to doing this at this point in time, but I will. Very happy with this product. Gives us added security as we already have a security system installed, with video capturing facilities.

Must have a Ring subscription to get all the perks. I have a subscription. Clear night vision. A bit delayed but does have preroll.I bought a spare battery so I can charge once the first battery is flat. Easy to hammer up on to external house wall. Great to answer rings when away from home.
